Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clockable
    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Clockable
    The controller connects to one temperature sensor and one heater. The controller will turn on the heater when the temperature is below 68.0. The controller will turn off the heater when the temperature is above 71.0 degrees.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Controller()
      Create a controller
      Controller​(Logger logger)
      Create a controller

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clock()
      Do one pass of the controller (read the temperature, determine whether to turn heater on or off, and then do it)
      void connect​(Blower blower)
      Connect the blower to the controller Only one connection at a time is possible.
      void connect​(Heater heater)
      Connect the heater to the controller.
      void connect​(TempSensor ts)
      Connect the temperature sensor to the controller.
      boolean hasBlower()
      Determine if a blower is connected
      void preClock()
      Do actions before clock (none needed yet)
      java.lang.String toString()
      Provide the string “Controller with TS:{UID} = {temperature} and Heater:{UID} = {state}” example: Contoller with TS:10000 = 75.0 and Heater:20000 = ON Use "no xyz" if there is no corresponding object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Provide the string “Controller with TS:{UID} = {temperature} and Heater:{UID} = {state}” example: Contoller with TS:10000 = 75.0 and Heater:20000 = ON Use "no xyz" if there is no corresponding object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string

      • connect

        public void connect​(TempSensor ts)
        Connect the temperature sensor to the controller. Only one connection at a time is possible. The method will silently overwrite on multiple requests.
        Parameters:
        ts - temperature sensor

      • connect

        public void connect​(Heater heater)
        Connect the heater to the controller. Only one connection at a time is possible. The method will silently overwrite on multiple requests.
        Parameters:
        heater - heater to connect

      • connect

        public void connect​(Blower blower)
        Connect the blower to the controller Only one connection at a time is possible. The method will silently overwrite on multiple requests.
        Parameters:
        blower - blower to connect

      • hasBlower

        public boolean hasBlower()
        Determine if a blower is connected
        Returns:
